ai.summary: A challenging 17.7 km section of the Lea Valley Walk in the UK, following the River Lea through a mix of urban towpaths, waterways, and rural riverbanks. The route is long and steady, with little technical terrain but a hard feel due to distance.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating, along river towpaths, gravel and surfaced paths, with sections along grassy embankments and boardwalks near water. Expect urban stretches, occasional stairs at locks, and some exposed sections.
ai.safety_notes: Plan around flood risk and potential towpath closures; share the path with cyclists; wear sturdy waterproof boots; carry a map and a fully charged phone; bring water and snacks; be prepared for muddy or uneven ground; exercise caution near water edges and unstable riverbanks.
recommended_gear: Fully charged phone with emergency contacts
Headlamp or flashlight for late finishes
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are best for daylight and milder weather; summer can be hot and dry; winter hiking is possible but often muddy and with reduced daylight.

seo.title: Lea Valley Walk – 17.7 km Hard Hike in the UK
